hi,
I had the same problem on a machine running Red Hat 8.0
It seems that something goes wrong with the include directories. I 
couldn't fix it thru the Makefiles and configure but when I changed 
the includes on lines 16 and 17 of the file:

.../Cantera/python/src/pycantera.cpp

to the absolute path of the header files (in my case to):

#include "/home/local/include/python2.3/Python.h"
#include "/home/local/include/python2.3/Numeric/arrayobject.h"

the compilation went thru

...hope this helps

cheers
George
